pesticide.PPE: Long-sleeved shirt and long pants, chemical-resistant gloves such as nitrile rubber, natural rubber, or butyl rubber, shoes plus socks, protective eyewear (goggles, safety glasses, or face shield), and a dust/mist filtering respirator if using a high-pressure hand-wand sprayer.

Safety_Information.general_Info: WARNING: Causes eye irritation. May cause skin irritation. Prolonged or frequently repeated skin contact may cause allergic reactions in some individuals. Do not get into eyes, on skin, or on clothing. Avoid prolonged contact with skin. Avoid breathing spray mist. Do not take internally.
Safety_Information.if_In_Eyes: Hold eye open and rinse slowly and gently with water for 15-20 minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present, after the first 5 minutes, then continue rinsing eye. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_Swallowed: Call a poison control center or doctor immediately for treatment advice. Have person sip a glass of water if able to swallow. Do not induce vomiting unless told to do so by a poison control center or doctor. Do not give anything by mouth to an unconscious or convulsing person.
Safety_Information.if_Inhaled: Move person to fresh air. If person is not breathing, call 911 or an ambulance, then give artificial respiration, preferably mouth-to-mouth, if possible. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_On_Skin: Take off contaminated clothing. Rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15-20 minutes. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.physician_Note: Persons having temporary irritation may respond to treatment with antihistamines or steroid creams and/or systemic steroids.
